alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Seminole (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 1:54PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Jackson, northwestern Gulf, east central Bay and Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida, western Gadsden and northwestern Liberty Counties in Big Bend of Florida, southwestern Decatur and southeastern Seminole Counties in southwestern Georgia through 230 PM EDT/130 PM CDT/... At 153 PM EDT/1253 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Chattahoochee to near Blountstown to 11 miles west of Stonemill Creek. Movement was northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Panama City, Lynn Haven, Callaway, Blountstown, Quincy, Springfield, Greensboro, Hiland Park, Chattahoochee, Sneads, Gretna, Bristol, Grand Ridge, Altha, Rock Bluff, Moose Pond, Clarksville, Ocheesee, Juniper and Douglas City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
